text: [Music]
hey everybody thomas joseph here from
kitchen conundrums and today i am
answering one of the most popular
questions that i have been asked and
that is a how-to on french macaroons or
most people say French macaron if you
really want to be serious about them and
that is this little almond egg white
cookie that sandwiches of some sort of
tasty filling and today I'm gonna show
you the tricks and tips behind making
these little French macaroons and we're
gonna start here with the base for the
cookie what you need to be here is very
precise so I have a digital scale
because you really need to know the
exact grams for this recipe so I need 71
grams of blanched sliced almonds and
that's about 2/3 of a cup so I have tare
doubt or zero doubt the bowl that I have
here on my scale and I'm going to
measure 71 grams and now this goes into
the bowl of a food processor here and
now I need 117 grams of confectioner's
sugar so now this goes into the
processor process this up for about a
minute and now I have a fine mesh sieve
and this is really to ensure that you
don't have any giant pieces of almond
because you want this cookie to be very
fine in texture you're just going to
stir the mixture in the sieve and as you
can see there are still some decent
sized pieces of the almonds left so we
need to reprocess this now and we're
gonna continue this process until
there's two tablespoons left in the
strainer once there's two tablespoons
left in the strainer you're done and
what you're gonna do is you're going to
discard those two tablespoons I know
it's a little weird but it does make
sense because it ensures that you have
the proper consistency and texture and
also
the right quantity okay so the second
process here again sifting and gently
pressing the almond confectioner sugar
mixture through the sieve and you want
to be left with just under two
tablespoons of this powder so I would
say that this is perfect so now for the
cookie batter we need two egg whites at
room temperature cold egg whites do not
achieve as much volume as we're in
temperature egg whites and to that I'm
going to add a quarter of a cup of
granulated sugar and that is 53 grams of
sugar now this goes right in with the
egg whites here now typically with a
French meringue which is egg whites and
sugar whisk together in a mixer you
gradually add the sugar but in this case
it all gets added in at the start so I'm
using my hand here to give it a good
stir before using the mixer so now I'm
gonna start mixing my egg whites on
medium speed for two minutes make sure
you set your timer so it's been two
minutes I'm gonna restart my timer and
I'm going to increase the speed to
medium-high for another two minutes
alright so now set the timer yet again
for another two minutes and now increase
the speed to high and we're gonna beat
for the final two minutes okay so the
final two minutes are up and now here's
your chance to add any sort of coloring
and also if you wanted to add a little
bit of flavoring you could do so here
I'm going to make yellow macarons today
so I'm using a little bit of lemon
yellow gel paste now you want to make
sure that you use gel paste as opposed
to the food coloring that you would get
in a grocery store because it's too
loose it's too liquidy and it's gonna
mess with the chemical structure here so
you want a gel paste something that is
thick and viscous and I'm gonna put two
drops in make sure you do this when the
mixer is off don't do it while it's
running and now eat this again
for 30 seconds on high speed until it's
dipped peaks and now you want to add in
that almond and confectioner sugar
mixture and using a rubber spatula fold
this mixture in to the egg whites so
bring the mixture up to the side of the
bowl and then scraping around the side
so you want to repeat this process for
35 times and you want the consistency to
be like a little bit like thick lava
here and this looks great you don't want
it to be too thin because it's gonna run
out of the bag so transfer to a pastry
bag with a three-quarter inch round tip
make sure your oven is preheated to 350
degrees with the rack in the lower third
of the oven now I have a cookie sheet
here and some parchment now a little
trick to keep the parchment secure while
you're piping
use a tiny bit of batter right in the
corners and what this does is it helps
to keep the parchment on the cookie
sheet and it doesn't lift up when you
pipe now we need about 3/4 inch in
diameter little circles here and you're
gonna pipe straight down once you get to
3/4 of an inch
give a bit of a swirl and continue now
you want these to be about an inch apart
so now you have to tap the pan against
your countertop two to three times
that's the way you won't get any air
bubbles so now these go right into the
oven now most recipes out there you see
for French macaroons they tell you to
let the cookies rest you don't need to
do it with this recipe these go right
into the oven so our cookies here have
baked for 13 minutes until they are
risen and just set and you want to make
sure that when you're baking them that
you rotate them half way through once
they come out of the oven as they are
now leave them alone do not touch them
let them cool completely before you move
them because they are super fragile when
they're warm
so our cookies have completely cooled
and what you want to do is you want to
take one of these offset spatulas and
you are going to gently glide underneath
the cookies to release them from the
parchment they should come off fairly
easily and now for the fun part the
fillings now you can really use so many
different fillings from jams to curds
you can make a lemon curd an orange curd
a lime
Hurd would even be great pastry cream
works butter creams and chocolate and
also caramel sauce this is a lemon
butter cream and all you really have to
do is put a little bit of the
buttercream or where you're filling in
the center of your cookie and sandwich
with your second cookie there now one
little trick if you really like filling
and you want to kind of maximize the
amount you can use your thumb and gently
press into the center of your cookie
only applying pressure with your thumb
and what that does is it creates a well
so you can fit that much more filling
into your cookies and now there you go
you have your sandwich macarons now the
good thing about these cookies is you
can make these cookies up to read five
days in advance just make sure that
their sandwich and put into your
refrigerator and they'll actually get an
even better texture a softer texture so
there you go macaroons 101 enjoy
[Music]
